intro: Litsea hayatae, commonly known as the Hainan litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to southern China, particularly the Hainan Island, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a leathery texture with a distinctive aromatic scent. Litsea hayatae plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
